page.title: 02LONG MYND CHURCH STRETTON
page.content: The{Long Mynd}is the longest hill in Shropshire. It is partly owned by the National Trust. It is 3 to 4 miles broad, nearly 1,700 feet in height and 10 miles in length. From the top there are lovely views. The Long Mynd is divided by valleys like{Batch Valley, Inwood, Cwm Dale} and{Cardingmill Valley.} There is plenty of flat land on top where you can play cricket and rounders and fly kites. You can drive up in your car and park on the grass. Some local farmers have grazing rights and keep their sheep and ponies up there. The Long Mynd is a peaceful place where lots of tourists go to walk or picnic.
